alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:43AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND, NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, BOONE AND SOUTHERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM EST... At 443 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Rising Sun, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Madeira, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue and Fort Wright. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 12. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 17 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 176 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
